sentences: Kontrollige, kas kõik asjad on alles.
Vanaema kirst on meil veel alles.
Ah alles homme, kas täna ei saaks?
Tulin alles töölt, pole jõudnud veel riideki vahetada.
context: The Estonian word 'alles' is an adverb with multiple meanings depending on context. It can mean 'still/remaining/surviving' when referring to things that continue to exist, as in 'pool leiba on söödud, pool on alles' (half the bread has been eaten, half remains). It can also mean 'quite recently' or 'just now' when describing timing, such as 'tulin alles töölt' (I just came from work). Additionally, it can express 'not until/before' for temporal sequences like 'alles nüüd ma märkan' (only now do I notice). Another usage is 'still/in the process of continuing' to show ongoing actions or states. The word also appears in exclamations meaning 'quite/really' with positive or negative connotations.
